009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * Scalar version of the Perona-Malik filter, without gradient array. This code is based on the Anisotropic Diffusion
019 * filter proposed by Perona and Malik, as proposed in [1]. See Sec. 17.3.2 of [2] for additional details. The filter
020 * operates on all types of grayscale (scalar) and RGB color images. Consult the source code of the related ImageJ
021 * plugins for examples.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] Pietro Perona and Jitendra Malik, "Scale-space and edge detection using anisotropic diffusion", IEEE Transactions
025 * on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, vol. 12, no. 4, pp. 629-639 (July 1990).
026 * <br>
027 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
028 * (2022).
029 * </p>
030 *
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2021/01/02
033 */
034public class PeronaMalikFilterScalar extends GenericFilterScalar implements PeronaMalikF {
035        
036        private final int iterations;           // number of iterations
037        private final float alpha;
038        private final ConductanceFunction g;
039        private final float[] A = new float[4];                 // tmp array for neighbor values
040        
041        // constructor - using default parameters
042        public PeronaMalikFilterScalar () {
043                this(new Parameters());
044        }
045        
046        // constructor - use this version to set all parameters
047        public PeronaMalikFilterScalar (Parameters params) {
048                this.iterations = params.iterations;
049                this.alpha = (float)params.alpha;
050                this.g = ConductanceFunction.get(params.conductanceFunType, (float)params.kappa);
051        }
052        
053        // ------------------------------------------------------
054        
055        @Override
056        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
057                /*   
058                 *  NH pixels:      directions:
059                 *      a1              1
060                 *   a2 ac a0        2  x  0
061                 *      a3              3
062                 */
063                
064                float ac = plane.getVal(u, v);
065                A[0] = plane.getVal(u + 1, v);
066                A[1] = plane.getVal(u, v - 1);
067                A[2] = plane.getVal(u - 1, v);
068                A[3] = plane.getVal(u, v + 1);
069                        
070                float delta = 0;
071                for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
072                        float d = A[i] - ac;
073                        delta = delta + (g.eval(Math.abs(d))) * d;
074                }
075                
076                return ac + alpha * delta;
077        }
078        
079//      @Override
080//      protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
081//              /*   
082//               *  NH pixels:      directions:
083//               *      p4              3
084//               *   p3 p0 p1        2  x  0
085//               *      p2              1
086//               */
087//              float[] p = new float[5];
088//              p[0] = plane.getVal(u, v);
089//              p[1] = plane.getVal(u + 1, v);
090//              p[2] = plane.getVal(u, v + 1);
091//              p[3] = plane.getVal(u - 1, v);
092//              p[4] = plane.getVal(u, v - 1);
093//                      
094//              float result = p[0];
095//              for (int i = 1; i <= 4; i++) {
096//                      float d = p[i] - p[0];
097//                      result = result + alpha * (g.eval(Math.abs(d))) * (d);
098//              }
099//              
100//              return result;
101//      }
102
103        @Override
104        protected final int passesRequired() {
105                return iterations;      // this filter needs T passes
106        }
107
108}
